duties_responsibilities.duty: Apply expert knowledge to develop innovative solutions to technically challenging projects.
Organize work, monitor, report, and achieve progress to schedule.
Provide input to project scheduling for dependencies, durations, and manpower requirements.
Review technical requirements for Piping Stress Engineering and establish stress Design Basis/philosophy for various load cases.
Conduct pipe stress engineering of piping systems as per ASME codes using CAESAR II software program.
Perform static analysis using CAESAR II for various load cases such as dead weight, sustained loads, thermal expansion/contraction, wave acceleration, etc.
Perform evaluation of nozzle loads utilizing WRC 107/297 capability of Caesar II program.
Conduct FEA evaluation of stresses at nozzles and for user-calculated SIFs.
Coordinate design of exclusive pipe supports as needed.
Extract engineering data from CAD drawings and computer models.
Develop detailed requisitions for pipe stress equipment and materials.
Review vendor drawing submittals and conduct technical bid evaluation.
Develop and issue parameters, data sheets, and varied construction documents.
Guide technically to CAD designer, drafters, and engineers working on the same pipe stress project.
Participate in reviews of PFD's, P&ID's, Piping ISOs, and Structural Drawings.
Assist with job interviews, conduct performance reviews, and make recommendations for hiring.
Responsible for engineering quality and timeliness in a highly cross-functional engineering environment.
Prepare documentation, reports, correspondence, procedures, specifications, and technical calculations.
Develop piping schematics and layouts based on customer requirements and specifications.
Provide technical follow-up and support on piping matters, from proposal stage to aftermarket.
Respond to classification and customer comment letters.
Good knowledge with piping components materials and specifications.
Basic understanding of process requirements and operations.
Able to do material take-offs and center of gravity calculations.
Willing to travel if required to participate in HAZOPs, project reviews, fabrication site visits for approximately two weeks.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering (Master's preferred)
